editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.author: RASIS
msItem.title: Diuisiones
msItem.rubric: Liber diuisionum translatus a Magistro G. Cremonensi urbis Abubegi filii Çacarie insuper antidotarium et quidam tractatus de simplicibus medicinis.
msItem.incipit: Ventilata fuit in presencia cuiusdam probi uiri rememoracio
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt sinonoma et liber diuisionum translatus a magistro Gerardo Cremonensi de arabico in latinum in ciuitate Toleto. Feliciter.
msItem.note: The first leaf was already badly faded by s. xv, and the first half of col. a was rewritten, in an anglicana hand, at that date.

msItem.author: Ps.-GALEN
msItem.title: Medical experiments
msItem.incipit: Dixit Galienus Ignis qui descendit de celo super altare
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, Venice 1490, I, fols. 177–81v; eTK 0658I. Also in Oxford, Balliol Coll. 285, fols. 198–207, and Cambridge, Pembroke Coll. 11, fols. 49–66v.

msItem.author: RASIS
msItem.title: Liber Almansoris
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Albubezi Rasis filii Zacharie translatus a magistro Gerardo Cremonensi de arabico in latinum in Tholeto qui ab eo uocatur Almassor eo quod regis Almassoris Ysaac filii precepto editus est uerba Albubezi.
msItem.incipit: Creator omnium Deus ossa condidit ut per ea corpus substentaretur
msItem.finalRubric: Finito libro referimus gratias Christo amen amen.
msItem.note: Towards the end extensive passages of gloss are written in the margin by the main scribe, ruled for ad hoc.
A number of prescriptions, much rubbed, are written in a neat bookhand little later than the main text.

supportDesc.extent:
166 leaves of parchment prepared in the Italian manner (ii + 164) 285 180
205 130
The edges retrimmed, affecting marginalia, and spattered with red.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 51 lines. The lower margins of fols. 12–13, 83, 86 have been excised.

decoDesc.decoNote: Orange and white initials with simple floral ornament, on square blue grounds, in Italian style; red or blue initials highlighted in the other colour; red or blue paraphs.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. i-ii, 163–4 are paper blanks.

history.provenance: At the foot of f. 60, in a small early hand, is ‘.M. Randulfi pro primo quaterno diuisionum’. In the outer margin of f. 1 is an erasure, and ‘tradatur cum rosa m’.

In the lower margin, partly over erasure (of which only ‘Liber de at’ can be read), ‘Liber Willelmi Balydene ex empcione’. William Balynden (BRUO 101) was fellow of Merton in 1374, until 1379. Rust-marks near the foot of f. 162v may just possibly be from the large iron chain-staple. Doubtless given by Balynden, certainly at the College by 1556: UO65. 407.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with titles, s. xvii, and ‘P. 2. 11. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘N. 1. 2 (CCXVIII)’ in red; the College bookplate. ‘11’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 89; Powicke, no. 1233; Alexander & Temple, no. 906.
